text: Show me the incentive and I will show you the outcome.
author: Charlie Munger

text: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's mind there are few.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

text: The most dangerous phrase in the language is: We've always done it this way.
author: Grace Hopper

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: A problem well-stated is a problem half-solved.
author: Charles Kettering

text: The quality of your decisions determines the quality of your life.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Think like a man of action, act like a man of thought.
author: Henri Bergson

text: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in mind at the same time and still retain the ability to function.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: Compound interest is the eighth wonder of the world. He who understands it, earns it; he who doesn't, pays it.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.
author: Warren Buffett

text: The map is not the territory.
author: Alfred Korzybski

text: To a man with a hammer, everything looks like a nail.
author: Charlie Munger

text: Invert, always invert.
author: Carl Jacobi

text: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself — and you are the easiest person to fool.
author: Richard Feynman

text: It is remarkable how much long-term advantage people like us have gotten by trying to be consistently not stupid, instead of trying to be very intelligent.
author: Charlie Munger

text: The best thinking has been done in solitude. The worst has been done in turmoil.
author: Thomas Edison

text: We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: The ability to destroy your ideas rapidly instead of slowly when the occasion is right is one of the most valuable things.
author: Charlie Munger

text: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The mind that opens to a new idea never returns to its original size.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Correlation is not causation.
author: Statistical Wisdom

text: The difference between successful people and really successful people is that really successful people say no to almost everything.
author: Warren Buffett

text: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.
author: Warren Buffett

text: The chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.
author: Warren Buffett

text: Never attribute to malice that which is adequately explained by stupidity.
author: Hanlon's Razor

text: The best time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: What the wise do in the beginning, fools do in the end.
author: Warren Buffett

text: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world. The unreasonable man persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore, all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Knowing what you don't know is more useful than being brilliant.
author: Charlie Munger

text: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The world is full of obvious things which nobody by any chance ever observes.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

text: All models are wrong, but some are useful.
author: George Box

text: The more you learn, the more you realize how much you don't know.
author: Aristotle

text: In theory, theory and practice are the same. In practice, they are not.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure.
author: Goodhart's Law

text: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
author: Henri Bergson

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: The chief task in life is simply this: to identify and separate matters so that I can say clearly to myself which are externals not under my control, and which have to do with the choices I actually control.
author: Epictetus

text: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response.
author: Viktor Frankl

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: It is not things that disturb us, but our judgments about things.
author: Epictetus

text: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: We suffer more in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.
author: Seneca

text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a man who is alive.
author: Seneca

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

text: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.
author: Epictetus

text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?
author: Epictetus

text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: To be calm is the highest achievement of the self.
author: Zen Proverb

text: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
author: Seneca

text: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

text: Concentrate every minute on doing what's in front of you with precise and genuine seriousness.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: To bear trials with a calm mind robs misfortune of its strength and burden.
author: Seneca

text: What we do now echoes in eternity.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
author: Epictetus

text: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
author: Seneca

text: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms — you'll be able to use them better when you're older.
author: Seneca

text: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: It is not the man who has too little that is poor, but the one who hankers after more.
author: Seneca

text: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

text: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

text: Culture eats strategy for breakfast.
author: Peter Drucker
note: Relevant for AI transformation change management

text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
author: African Proverb

text: Management is doing things right. Leadership is doing the right things.
author: Peter Drucker

text: The bottleneck is always at the top of the bottle.
author: Peter Drucker

text: A leader is best when people barely know he exists. When his work is done, they will say: we did it ourselves.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The task of leadership is not to put greatness into people, but to elicit it, for the greatness is there already.
author: John Buchan

text: Before you are a leader, success is all about growing yourself. When you become a leader, success is all about growing others.
author: Jack Welch

text: The growth and development of people is the highest calling of leadership.
author: Harvey Firestone

text: Leadership is the capacity to translate vision into reality.
author: Warren Bennis

text: The quality of a leader is reflected in the standards they set for themselves.
author: Ray Kroc

text: Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers.
author: Colin Powell

text: Leadership is not about being in charge. It's about taking care of those in your charge.
author: Simon Sinek

text: The greatest leader is not necessarily one who does the greatest things, but one who gets people to do the greatest things.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: You manage things; you lead people.
author: Grace Hopper

text: A genuine leader is not a searcher for consensus but a molder of consensus.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: The key to successful leadership is influence, not authority.
author: Ken Blanchard

text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
author: Steve Jobs

text: People buy into the leader before they buy into the vision.
author: John Maxwell

text: Outstanding leaders go out of their way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel.
author: Sam Walton

text: It is better to lead from behind and to put others in front.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Effective leadership is putting first things first. Effective management is discipline, carrying it out.
author: Stephen Covey

text: The best executive is one who has sense enough to pick good people to do what they want done.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Don't tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results.
author: George Patton

text: Leadership is not about titles, positions, or flowcharts. It is about one life influencing another.
author: John Maxwell

text: A leader takes people where they want to go. A great leader takes people where they don't necessarily want to go, but ought to be.
author: Rosalynn Carter

text: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Average leaders raise the bar on themselves; good leaders raise the bar for others; great leaders inspire others to raise their own bar.
author: Orrin Woodward

text: He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.
author: Aristotle

text: Speed is the form of ecstasy the technical revolution has bestowed on man.
author: Milan Kundera
note: Reminder to slow down, resist urgency addiction

text: The ability to simplify means to eliminate the unnecessary so that the necessary may speak.
author: Hans Hofmann

text: If I had eight hours to chop down a tree, I'd spend six hours sharpening my axe.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Don't let perfect be the enemy of good.
author: Voltaire

text: Clarity about what matters provides clarity about what does not.
author: Cal Newport

text: The main thing is to keep the main thing the main thing.
author: Stephen Covey

text: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
author: Annie Dillard

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Theophrastus

text: Take care of the minutes and the hours will take care of themselves.
author: Lord Chesterfield

text: A wealth of information creates a poverty of attention.
author: Herbert Simon

text: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The shorter way to do many things is to do only one thing at a time.
author: Mozart

text: Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.
author: Peter Drucker

text: You can do anything, but not everything.
author: David Allen

text: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.
author: Socrates

text: It's not enough to be busy. The question is: what are we busy about?
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Focus is a matter of deciding what things you're not going to do.
author: John Carmack

text: Where focus goes, energy flows.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The key is not to prioritize what's on your schedule, but to schedule your priorities.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Most of what we say and do is not essential. If you can eliminate it, you'll have more time, and more tranquility.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Starve your distractions and feed your focus.
author: Unknown

text: Doing less is not being lazy. Don't give in to a culture that values personal sacrifice over personal productivity.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: Essentialism is not about how to get more things done; it's about how to get the right things done.
author: Greg McKeown

text: The ability to concentrate and to use your time well is everything.
author: Lee Iacocca

text: Simplicity boils down to two steps: Identify the essential. Eliminate the rest.
author: Leo Babauta

text: Deep work is the ability to focus without distraction on a cognitively demanding task.
author: Cal Newport

text: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent; it is the one most adaptable to change.
author: Charles Darwin

text: A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for.
author: John A. Shedd

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Every action you take is a vote for the type of person you wish to become.
author: James Clear

text: The more you sweat in training, the less you bleed in combat.
author: Richard Marcinko

text: When you're finished changing, you're finished.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the person who is doing it.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems.
author: James Clear

text: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: The expert in anything was once a beginner.
author: Helen Hayes

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The secret of change is to focus all of your energy not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
author: Socrates

text: It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: I am not what happened to me. I am what I choose to become.
author: Carl Jung

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: Hard times create strong men. Strong men create good times. Good times create weak men. Weak men create hard times.
author: G. Michael Hopf

text: The best time for new beginnings is now.
author: Unknown

text: If you don't know where you're going, any road will get you there.
author: Lewis Carroll

text: The greatest enemy of a good plan is the dream of a perfect plan.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

text: Vision without execution is hallucination.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Strategy is about making choices, trade-offs; it's about deliberately choosing to be different.
author: Michael Porter

text: However beautiful the strategy, you should occasionally look at the results.
author: Winston Churchill

text: In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

text: The essence of strategy is choosing what not to do.
author: Michael Porter

text: Good strategy has an essential logical structure: a diagnosis, a guiding policy, and coherent action.
author: Richard Rumelt

text: The best strategy is always to be very strong.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

text: Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Know the enemy and know yourself; in a hundred battles you will never be in peril.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
author: Sun Tzu

text: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
author: Sun Tzu

text: All warfare is based on deception.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
author: Sun Tzu

text: If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Speed is the essence of war. Take advantage of the enemy's unpreparedness.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Move swift as the wind and closely-formed as the wood. Attack like the fire and be still as the mountain.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Build your opponent a golden bridge to retreat across.
author: Sun Tzu

text: The wise warrior avoids the battle.
author: Sun Tzu

text: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The best time to strike is when the iron is hot.
author: Proverb

text: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
author: Sun Tzu

text: He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.
author: Sun Tzu

text: What gets measured gets managed.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Your margin is someone else's opportunity.
author: Jeff Bezos

text: The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Business has only two functions — marketing and innovation.
author: Peter Drucker

text: It's not about ideas. It's about making ideas happen.
author: Scott Belsky

text: Revenue is vanity, profit is sanity, but cash is king.
author: Business Saying

text: The goal is not to do business with everybody who needs what you have. The goal is to do business with people who believe what you believe.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
author: Bill Gates

text: Make your product easier to buy than your competition, or you will find your customers buying from them, not you.
author: Mark Cuban

text: If you're not embarrassed by the first version of your product, you've launched too late.
author: Reid Hoffman

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: Be stubborn on vision, but flexible on details.
author: Jeff Bezos

text: The customer rarely buys what the company thinks it's selling.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Don't find customers for your products, find products for your customers.
author: Seth Godin

text: In the world of business, the people who are most successful are those who are doing what they love.
author: Warren Buffett

text: Get closer than ever to your customers. So close that you tell them what they need well before they realize it themselves.
author: Steve Jobs

text: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
author: Henry Ford

text: The golden rule for every business: Put yourself in your customer's place.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: Your brand is what people say about you when you're not in the room.
author: Jeff Bezos

text: Business opportunities are like buses, there's always another one coming.
author: Richard Branson

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

text: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

text: The only thing I know is that I know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
author: Albert Einstein

text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

text: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: Any fool can know. The point is to understand.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

text: He who knows others is wise; he who knows himself is enlightened.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The wise man is one who knows what he does not know.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are.
author: Lao Tzu

text: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.
author: Lao Tzu

text: A great nation is like a great man: when he makes a mistake, he realizes it.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
author: Confucius

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
author: Confucius

text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: To see what is right and not do it is the want of courage.
author: Confucius

text: The man who asks a question is a fool for a minute, the man who does not ask is a fool for life.
author: Confucius

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: Desire to have things done quickly prevents their being done thoroughly.
author: Confucius

text: When you see a good person, think of becoming like them. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.
author: Confucius

text: Seek not the things that are too hard for thee, neither search the things that are above thy strength.
author: Confucius

text: Free education is abundant, all over the Internet. It's the desire to learn that's scarce.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Escape competition through authenticity.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Specific knowledge is knowledge that you cannot be trained for.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: The way to get rich is to give society what it wants but doesn't know how to get. At scale.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Code and media are permissionless leverage.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Play long-term games with long-term people.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Pick an industry where you can play long-term games with long-term people.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Arm yourself with specific knowledge, accountability, and leverage.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Read what you love until you love to read.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: You're not going to get rich renting out your time.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Seek wealth, not money or status.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Earn with your mind, not your time.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Become the best in the world at what you do. Keep redefining what you do until this is true.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: The most important skill for getting rich is becoming a perpetual learner.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Fortunes require leverage. Business leverage comes from capital, people, and products with no marginal cost of replication.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: A calm mind, a fit body, and a house full of love. These things cannot be bought. They must be earned.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: All the real benefits in life come from compound interest.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Desire is a contract you make with yourself to be unhappy until you get what you want.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: The modern struggle: Lone individuals summoning inhuman willpower, fasting, meditating, to control the excesses of modern diets and media.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: If you're not willing to do a wholesale, 100% swap with who that person is, then you have no right to complain.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Habits are everything. At the end of the day, you are your habits.
author: James Clear

text: Goals are good for setting a direction, but systems are best for making progress.
author: James Clear

text: The task of breaking a bad habit is like uprooting a powerful oak within us.
author: James Clear

text: Small habits don't add up. They compound.
author: James Clear

text: Environment is the invisible hand that shapes human behavior.
author: James Clear

text: Time magnifies the margin between success and failure. It will multiply whatever you feed it.
author: James Clear

text: When nothing seems to help, I go and look at a stonecutter hammering away at his rock.
author: Jacob Riis

text: Be the designer of your world and not merely the consumer of it.
author: James Clear

text: The secret to getting results that last is to never stop making improvements.
author: James Clear

text: The ultimate form of intrinsic motivation is when a habit becomes part of your identity.
author: James Clear

text: Every action is a vote for the type of person you wish to become.
author: James Clear

text: We don't rise to the level of our expectations, we fall to the level of our training.
author: Archilochus

text: Missing once is an accident. Missing twice is the start of a new habit.
author: James Clear

text: You should be far more concerned with your current trajectory than with your current results.
author: James Clear

text: The most effective way to change your habits is to focus not on what you want to achieve, but on who you wish to become.
author: James Clear

text: You get what you repeat.
author: James Clear

text: We imitate the habits of three groups in particular: the close, the many, and the powerful.
author: James Clear

text: The difference between a good day and a bad day is often a few productive hours.
author: James Clear

text: Professionals stick to the schedule; amateurs let life get in the way.
author: James Clear

text: Being poor is not having too little, it is wanting more.
author: Seneca

text: Discipline equals freedom.
author: Jocko Willink

text: Extreme ownership: Leaders must own everything in their world. There is no one else to blame.
author: Jocko Willink

text: Don't expect to be motivated every day to get out there and make things happen. You won't be. Don't count on motivation. Count on discipline.
author: Jocko Willink

text: Two is one, and one is none.
author: Jocko Willink

text: The only way to not feel the pain of discipline is to feel the pain of regret.
author: Jocko Willink

text: Good. If something bad happens, you can figure out a way to turn it into something good.
author: Jocko Willink

text: Stop researching every aspect of it and reading all about it and debating the pros and cons of it. Start doing it.
author: Jocko Willink

text: Default aggressive. Move forward. Don't wait to be told what to do.
author: Jocko Willink

text: Relax. Look around. Make a call.
author: Jocko Willink

text: Prioritize and execute.
author: Jocko Willink

text: Never stop learning. Be humble enough to learn.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: Focus on being productive instead of busy.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: A person's success in life can usually be measured by the number of uncomfortable conversations they are willing to have.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: Being selective — doing less — is the path of the productive.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: The question you should be asking isn't, 'What do I want?' or 'What are my goals?' but 'What would excite me?'
author: Tim Ferriss

text: If you are insecure, guess what? The rest of the world is, too.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: Most people will choose unhappiness over uncertainty.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: The fishing is best where the fewest go and the collective insecurity of the world makes it easy for people to hit home runs while everyone is aiming for base hits.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: What you do is infinitely more important than how you do it.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: I value self-discipline, but creating systems that make it next to impossible to misbehave is more reliable than self-control.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: The most important actions are never comfortable.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: Life punishes the vague wish and rewards the specific ask.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: For all of the most important things, the timing always sucks. Just do it.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: Money is multiplied in practical value depending on the number of W's you control in your life: what you do, when you do it, where you do it, and with whom you do it.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: If you let your learning lead to knowledge, you become a fool. If you let your learning lead to action, you become wealthy.
author: Jim Rohn

text: You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.
author: Jim Rohn

text: We must all suffer one of two things: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Don't wish it was easier, wish you were better.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines, practiced every day.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Learn to work harder on yourself than you do on your job.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Rohn

text: If you really want to do something, you'll find a way. If you don't, you'll find an excuse.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Your life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Success is steady progress toward one's personal goals.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Investing in yourself is the best investment you will ever make.
author: Robin Sharma

text: The fears we don't face become our limits.
author: Robin Sharma

text: All change is hard at first, messy in the middle and gorgeous at the end.
author: Robin Sharma

text: If you're not scared a lot you're not doing very much.
author: Robin Sharma

text: The moment you take responsibility for everything in your life is the moment you can change anything in your life.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Small daily improvements over time lead to stunning results.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Your days are your life in miniature.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.
author: Robin Sharma

text: The quality of your life is determined by the quality of your thoughts.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Victims recite problems, leaders provide solutions.
author: Robin Sharma

text: If you want to have the results only 5% of the population have, you have to be willing to do what only 5% of the population are willing to do.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Your excuses are nothing more than lies your fears have sold you.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Stop managing your time. Start managing your focus.
author: Robin Sharma

text: To double your income, triple your investment in self-development.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Ordinary people have big TVs. Extraordinary people have big libraries.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Dreamers dream, leaders launch.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Work hard at your job and you'll make a living. Work hard on yourself and you'll make a fortune.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Change is hardest at the beginning, messiest in the middle and best at the end.
author: Robin Sharma

text: One of the greatest gifts you can give to anyone is the gift of your attention.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Your income right now is a result of your standards, it is not the industry, it is not the economy.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The path to success is to take massive, determined action.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The only thing that's keeping you from getting what you want is the story you keep telling yourself.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Identify your problems but give your power and energy to solutions.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Stay committed to your decisions, but stay flexible in your approach.
author: Tony Robbins

text: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Progress equals happiness.
author: Tony Robbins

text: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The secret of success is learning how to use pain and pleasure instead of having pain and pleasure use you.
author: Tony Robbins

text: It's not about the goal. It's about growing to become the person that can accomplish that goal.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Complexity is the enemy of execution.
author: Tony Robbins

text: If you can't you must. If you must you can.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Trade your expectations for appreciation and the world changes instantly.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The only limit to your impact is your imagination and commitment.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.
author: Tony Robbins

text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Never leave that till tomorrow which you can do today.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin
